title: The Big Two? This Alcaraz-Sinner rivalry is epic
description: Sinner and Alcaraz have combined to win the last six Grand Slams -- and are pushing each other to new heights in the sport.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Samsonova ousts Pegula in marathon Berlin match
description: Liudmila Samsonova saved two match points before beating third-ranked Jessica Pegula 6-7 (8), 7-5, 7-6 (5) on Wednesday to reach the quarterfinals of the Berlin Open.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Sinner on reality of No. 1: ‚ÄòEveryone wants to beat you‚Äô
description: How is Jannik Sinner adjusting to being a part of one of tennis‚Äô most exclusive clubs? Sinner became the 29th No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings, and the first Italian to reach top spot, on 10 June 2024. Having comfortably retained his position ever since, he is just the fifth member of the ATP No. 1 Club ‚Äî after Jimmy Connors, Lleyton Hewitt, Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic ‚Äî to spend more than 52 weeks in his first stint as World No. 1. It is illustrious company for a 23-year-old from the small village of San Candido to keep. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a huge honour for me, to be part of these names,‚Äù Sinner told ATPTour.com, when asked if he was becoming accustomed to featuring on such lists alongside some of the greatest players in tennis‚Äô history. ‚ÄúOn the other hand, I‚Äôm myself. I make my history for myself. Of course, it‚Äôs amazing company I am part of and as I always said, I would never have thought I would be in this position once in my life. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs amazing now that I am there, and I know my potential and know that I can do it if I‚Äôm playing very well. Things have changed, that‚Äôs for sure, but it‚Äôs amazing to be part of these names.‚Äù Having begun his 54th week as World No. 1 on Monday, Sinner has now surpassed Djokovic's first stint (53 weeks) as the world's top player. Despite the different feeling of being the frontrunner of the ATP Tour, Sinner says he has stuck to the same principles that got him to No. 1 during his first year at the top. It is an approach that certainly seems to be working. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt look at the rankings so much myself, because I feel like World No. 1, No. 2 or No. 3 is the result of what you work on, on a yearly basis,‚Äù explained the Italian. ‚ÄúYou have to be very consistent, and my results have been amazing since last year until now, so we will try to push in that direction as long as we can. ‚ÄúOn the other hand, the most important thing for me is to improve as a player. I think I made some good progress since last year. I feel like I‚Äôm a better player, which for me is the most important. Of course, the result matters, but it‚Äôs quite relevant for me. I do enjoy being in this position.‚Äù Number one with the winning ways üî•@ATPHalle #ATPHalle @janniksin pic.twitter.com/U90BdYMkLK‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) June 17, 2025 Sinner was speaking at the Terra Wortmann Open in Halle, where he made his debut as the No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings a year ago. The Italian went on to lift the trophy, his first on grass courts, that week at the German ATP 500, and he has barely stopped winning since. According to the Infosys ATP Win/Loss Index, Sinner is 59-5 since rising to World No. 1. He will aim to hit the 60-win mark as the world‚Äôs top player on Thursday in Halle, where he takes on another former champion at the ATP 500 in Alexander Bublik. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs a very special tournament because I made my debut as No. 1 here, and this tournament also supported me over many years,‚Äù reflected Sinner ahead of his first-round win against Yannick Hanfmann. ‚ÄúI always enjoy playing here and the atmosphere is very nice, so I always enjoy coming back. ‚ÄúObviously things have changed since last year a little bit. The feeling is definitely different, being No. 1, because everyone wants to beat you and there are still a lot of players who still have that feeling. I think the position in the rankings is something someone works a lot to be in, and I‚Äôve always tried to be the best I could.‚Äù [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Korda to miss rest of grass-court season due to this injury...
description: Sebastian Korda announced on Wednesday that he will miss the rest of the grass-court season, including Wimbledon, due to injury. The American is struggling with a stress fracture in his right shin and is currently in a boot and using crutches. ‚ÄúUnfortunately no Wimbledon for me this year,‚Äù Korda wrote on Instagram. ‚ÄúStress fracture in my shin during the clay. Been a tough 12 months, but better days ahead.‚Äù Korda is currently the No. 26 player in the PIF ATP Rankings and owns an 11-10 record for the season, according to the Infosys ATP Win/Loss Index. He recently made the third round at Roland Garros, where he fell to countryman Frances Tiafoe in the third round. The two-time ATP Tour titlist made the fourth round on his Wimbledon debut in 2021, but will not return to SW19 for the season‚Äôs third major until 2026. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Late racquet swap propels Draper into Queen's last eight
description: A bold decision to change racquet at a crucial point paid off for British number one Jack Draper, as he edged a third-set tie-break against Alexei Popyrin to reach the quarter-finals at Queen's.

title: GB's Jones knocked out of Nottingham
description: British wild card Francesca Jones misses out on the chance of back-to-back quarter-finals at Nottingham.

title: Alcaraz Saves 3 Championships Points to Defend Roland Garros Title
description: Carlos Alcaraz clinched his fifth Grand Slam title in a thrilling five-set battle against Jannik Sinner at Roland Garros on Sunday, rallying from two sets down to win 4-6, 6-7(4), 6-4, 7-6(3), 7-6(10-2). The match, the longest Roland Garros final ever at 5 hours and 29 minutes, saw Alcaraz save three championship points in the ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: French Open 2025 Semi Final Recap
description: Day Thirteen at Roland Garros delivered two very different semi-finals, but one clear outcome: the dream final is on. Carlos Alcaraz was the first to book his spot, recovering from a slow start to take control against Lorenzo Musetti, who was forced to retire early in the fourth set due to a leg injury. The ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan
